channel.title: Planet Money
channel.description: The economy explained. Imagine you could call up a friend and say, "Meet me at the bar and tell me what's going on with the economy." Now imagine that's actually a fun evening.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015-2020 NPR - For Personal Use Only
channel.itunes:summary: The economy explained. Imagine you could call up a friend and say, "Meet me at the bar and tell me what's going on with the economy." Now imagine that's actually a fun evening.
channel.itunes:author: NPR

item.title: Big Rigged
item.description: Driving a truck used to mean freedom. Now it means a mountain of debt. Subscribe to our weekly newsletter here.
item.copyright: Copyright 2015-2020 NPR - For Personal Use Only
item.itunes:title: Big Rigged
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:summary: Trucking companies have been underpaying workers for years. And now they've found a way to get them to buy the trucks too.
item.itunes:subtitle: Trucking companies have been underpaying workers for years. And now they've found a way to get them to buy the trucks too.
item.content:encoded: Driving a truck used to mean freedom. Now it means a mountain of debt. Subscribe to our weekly newsletter here.

item.title: Mask Communication
item.description: Why won't some people wear masks? Is there anything we can do to convince them? We look to behavioral economics for help. | Subscribe to our weekly newsletter here.
item.copyright: Copyright 2015-2020 NPR - For Personal Use Only
item.itunes:title: Mask Communication
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:summary: Behavioral economists have helped us smoke less and save more. Can they help us understand why some people won't wear masks, and find ways to get them to want to?
item.itunes:subtitle: Behavioral economists have helped us smoke less and save more. Can they help us understand why some people won't wear masks, and find ways to get them to want to?
item.content:encoded: Why won't some people wear masks? Is there anything we can do to convince them? We look to behavioral economics for help. | Subscribe to our weekly newsletter here.

item.title: College Fails
item.description: The pandemic is transforming college from a can't-miss into a can't-attend experience. Can colleges survive? | Subscribe to our weekly newsletter here.
item.copyright: Copyright 2015-2020 NPR - For Personal Use Only
item.itunes:title: College Fails
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:summary: With a month to go before the fall semester starts, universities are closing due to coronavirus, and also making hard cuts and tradeoffs around remote learning.
item.itunes:subtitle: With a month to go before the fall semester starts, universities are closing due to coronavirus, and also making hard cuts and tradeoffs around remote learning.
item.content:encoded: The pandemic is transforming college from a can't-miss into a can't-attend experience. Can colleges survive? | Subscribe to our weekly newsletter here.

item.title: SUMMER SCHOOL 4: Scarcity & Pistachios
item.description: Class 4 brings us an economic conundrum: how do you efficiently share a scarce resource? | Subscribe to our weekly newsletter here.
item.copyright: Copyright 2015-2020 NPR - For Personal Use Only
item.itunes:title: SUMMER SCHOOL 4: Scarcity & Pistachios
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:summary: Learn about scarce resources and the tragedy of the commons from drought-stricken California.
item.itunes:subtitle: Learn about scarce resources and the tragedy of the commons from drought-stricken California.
item.content:encoded: Class 4 brings us an economic conundrum: how do you efficiently share a scarce resource? | Subscribe to our weekly newsletter here.
